meanings.definition: To bend the knee or touch one knee to the ground in reverence or worship.
meanings.sent1: During the ceremony, the people will genuflect before the king.
meanings.sent2: It is customary to genuflect before entering the church.
meanings.sent3: The penguin decided to genuflect in front of the fish tank, showing respect to the goldfish.
meanings.sent4: As the sun set, the trees seemed to genuflect towards the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The knight's genuflection before the queen was a symbol of his loyalty.

meanings.definition: To show respect or submission by bending the knee.
meanings.sent1: The soldier would genuflect before his commanding officer as a sign of respect.
meanings.sent2: In some cultures, it is common to genuflect when greeting elders.
meanings.sent3: The cat decided to genuflect in front of the dog, acknowledging its dominance.
meanings.sent4: The skyscrapers seemed to genuflect towards the powerful storm approaching.
meanings.sent5: The gymnast's perfect genuflection impressed the judges at the competition.
